verses.plain: Lo, mine eye hath seen all this, mine ear hath heard and understood it.

tokens.t: Lo, mine eye hath seen all
, mine ear hath heard and understood it.

verses.plain: What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.

tokens.t: What ye know,
do I know also: I
not inferior unto you.

verses.plain: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.

tokens.t: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, and I desire to reason with God.

verses.plain: But ye are forgers of lies, ye are all physicians of no value.

tokens.t: But ye
forgers of lies, ye
all physicians of no value.

verses.plain: O that ye would altogether hold your peace! and it should be your wisdom.

tokens.t: O that ye would altogether hold your peace! and it should be your wisdom.

verses.plain: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.

tokens.t: Hear now my reasoning, and hearken to the pleadings of my lips.

verses.plain: Will ye speak wickedly for God? and talk deceitfully for him?

tokens.t: Will ye speak wickedly for God? and talk deceitfully for him?

verses.plain: Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?

tokens.t: Will ye accept his person? will ye contend for God?

verses.plain: Is it good that he should search you out? or as one man mocketh another, do ye so mock him?

tokens.t: Is it good that he should search you out? or as one man mocketh another, do ye
mock him?

verses.plain: He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.

tokens.t: He will surely reprove you, if ye do secretly accept persons.

verses.plain: Shall not his excellency make you afraid? and his dread fall upon you?

tokens.t: Shall not his excellency make you afraid? and his dread fall upon you?

verses.plain: Your remembrances are like unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.

tokens.t: Your remembrances
like unto ashes, your bodies to bodies of clay.

verses.plain: Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what will.

tokens.t: Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak, and let come on me what

verses.plain: Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in mine hand?

tokens.t: Wherefore do I take my flesh in my teeth, and put my life in mine hand?

verses.plain: Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.

tokens.t: Though he slay me, yet will I trust in him: but I will maintain mine own ways before him.

verses.plain: He also shall be my salvation: for an hypocrite shall not come before him.

tokens.t: He also
my salvation: for an hypocrite shall not come before him.

verses.plain: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.

tokens.t: Hear diligently my speech, and my declaration with your ears.

verses.plain: Behold now, I have ordered my cause; I know that I shall be justified.

tokens.t: Behold now, I have ordered
cause; I know that I shall be justified.

verses.plain: Who is he that will plead with me? for now, if I hold my tongue, I shall give up the ghost.

tokens.t: Who
he
will plead with me? for now, if I hold my tongue, I shall give up the ghost.

verses.plain: Only do not two things unto me: then will I not hide myself from thee.

tokens.t: Only do not two
unto me: then will I not hide myself from thee.

verses.plain: Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.

tokens.t: Withdraw thine hand far from me: and let not thy dread make me afraid.

verses.plain: Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.

tokens.t: Then call thou, and I will answer: or let me speak, and answer thou me.

verses.plain: How many are mine iniquities and sins? make me to know my transgression and my sin.

tokens.t: How many
mine iniquities and sins? make me to know my transgression and my sin.

verses.plain: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and holdest me for thine enemy?

tokens.t: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, and holdest me for thine enemy?

verses.plain: Wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro? and wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?

tokens.t: Wilt thou break a leaf driven to and fro? and wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?

verses.plain: For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.

tokens.t: For thou writest bitter things against me, and makest me to possess the iniquities of my youth.

verses.plain: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.

tokens.t: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, and lookest narrowly unto all my paths; thou settest a print upon the heels of my feet.

verses.plain: And he, as a rotten thing, consumeth, as a garment that is moth eaten.

tokens.t: And he, as a rotten thing, consumeth, as a garment that is moth eaten.

footnotes.text: Hold…: Heb. Be silent from me
